description.zh-cn: 中国大陆艺术家、社会活动家及异见人士，诗人艾青之子，活跃于建筑、艺术、影像和社会文化评论领域。
description.en: A Chinese contemporary artist, activist, and dissident. He is the son of poet Ai Qing and is active in the fields of architecture, art, film, and social and cultural criticism.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国首都，艾未未的出生地及长期居住地。
description.en: The capital of the People's Republic of China, and Ai Weiwei's birthplace and long-term residence.

description.zh-cn: 中国诗人，艾未未的父亲。
description.en: Chinese poet and the father of Ai Weiwei.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未的母亲。
description.en: The mother of Ai Weiwei.

description.zh-cn: 艺术家，艾未未的配偶，北京发课文化发展有限公司的法人代表。
description.en: Artist, spouse of Ai Weiwei, and the legal representative of Beijing Fake Cultural Development Ltd.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未曾于1978年入读的中国高等艺术院校。
description.en: A Chinese higher education institution for arts where Ai Weiwei enrolled in 1978.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未曾在美国就读的设计学院。
description.en: A design school in the United States that Ai Weiwei attended.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未的国籍国，也是其长期进行社会活动和批评的对象，其政府部门曾多次对其进行打压。
description.en: Ai Weiwei's country of nationality, and the subject of his long-term activism and criticism. Its governmental bodies have suppressed him on multiple occasions.

nodes.id: 汶川大地震死难学生调查活动

zh-cn: 汶川大地震死难学生调查活动

description.zh-cn: 由艾未未发起的，旨在调查2008年汶川大地震中遇难学生名单的社会活动。
description.en: A social activity initiated by Ai Weiwei to investigate the list of student victims in the 2008 Wenchuan earthquake.

description.zh-cn: 2008年发生于中国四川的特大地震，因大量校舍倒塌引发社会广泛质疑，促使艾未未发起了公民调查活动。
description.en: A major earthquake in Sichuan, China, in 2008. The collapse of numerous school buildings led to widespread public questioning and prompted Ai Weiwei to initiate a citizens' investigation.

description.zh-cn: 四川维权人士，艾未未曾为其出庭作证。
description.en: A human rights activist from Sichuan for whom Ai Weiwei appeared in court as a witness.

description.zh-cn: 负责调查和拘押艾未未的中国执法机构。其人员曾在成都殴打艾未未，并主导了2011年将其秘密关押81天的行动。
description.en: The Chinese law enforcement agency responsible for investigating and detaining Ai Weiwei. Its officers assaulted Ai in Chengdu and led the operation to secretly detain him for 81 days in 2011.

description.zh-cn: 时任北京市公安局局长，被指主导了对艾未未的迫害。
description.en: The then-director of the Beijing Municipal Public Security Bureau, who allegedly orchestrated the persecution of Ai Weiwei.

description.zh-cn: 北京市地税局对艾未未实际控制的北京发课文化发展有限公司提起的税务案件，被外界普遍认为是针对艾未未的政治打压。
description.en: A tax case brought by the Beijing Local Taxation Bureau against Beijing Fake Cultural Development Ltd., a company effectively controlled by Ai Weiwei. It is widely regarded as a form of political persecution against him.

description.zh-cn: 中国人权律师，曾作为艾未未方法人公司的代理律师处理“发课税案”。
description.en: A Chinese human rights lawyer who represented Ai Weiwei's legal entity company in the 'Fake Tax Case'.

description.zh-cn: 《人民日报》旗下的报纸，在艾未未被捕后发表多篇社评对其进行批评。
description.en: A newspaper under the People's Daily that published multiple editorials criticizing Ai Weiwei after his arrest.

description.zh-cn: 香港亲北京报纸，曾发文称艾未未“五毒俱全”。
description.en: A pro-Beijing newspaper in Hong Kong that published articles accusing Ai Weiwei of being thoroughly corrupt.

description.zh-cn: 香港立法会议员，曾指控艾未未的作品《透视研究：天安门》违反国安法、侮辱国家尊严。
description.en: A member of the Hong Kong Legislative Council who accused Ai Weiwei's work 'Study of Perspective: Tiananmen' of violating the National Security Law and insulting national dignity.

description.zh-cn: 香港西九文化区的视觉文化博物馆，因收藏并计划展出艾未未的争议性作品而引发政治风波，后决定不在开馆时展出相关作品。
description.en: A museum of visual culture in Hong Kong's West Kowloon Cultural District. Its collection and planned exhibition of Ai Weiwei's controversial works sparked political controversy, leading to the decision not to display them at the museum's opening.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未于1995年创作的摄影作品，内容为对着北京天安门竖起中指，该作品在香港M+博物馆的收藏引发了违反国安法的指控。
description.en: A 1995 photographic work by Ai Weiwei showing his middle finger raised towards Tiananmen Square in Beijing. The M+ museum's collection of this piece led to accusations that it violated the National Security Law.

description.zh-cn: 瑞士建筑事务所，与艾未未合作设计了北京国家体育场“鸟巢”。
description.en: A Swiss architectural firm that collaborated with Ai Weiwei on the design of the Beijing National Stadium, also known as the 'Bird's Nest'.

description.zh-cn: 2008年北京奥运会主场馆，艾未未作为艺术顾问参与了其设计过程。
description.en: The main stadium for the 2008 Beijing Olympics, for which Ai Weiwei served as the artistic consultant during its design.

en: Yang Jia's attack on Shanghai police

description.zh-cn: 杨佳持刀进入上海闸北公安分局，造成6名警员死亡的事件。艾未未质疑该案司法程序不公并制作了相关纪录片。
description.en: An incident where Yang Jia entered the Zhabei Public Security Bureau in Shanghai with a knife, resulting in the deaths of six police officers. Ai Weiwei questioned the fairness of the judicial process and produced a documentary on the case.

description.zh-cn: 因袭警案被处决的北京青年，艾未未曾为其制作纪录片，质疑司法不公。
description.en: A young man from Beijing who was executed for attacking police. Ai Weiwei made a documentary about him, questioning the fairness of the judicial process.

description.zh-cn: 上海维权人士，艾未未曾声援其返回上海的行动并制作纪录片。
description.en: A Shanghai-based human rights activist whose efforts to return to Shanghai were supported by Ai Weiwei, who also made a documentary about his case.

description.zh-cn: 丹麦玩具公司，曾因拒绝向艾未未出售积木用于政治作品而引发争议，后改变其销售政策。
description.en: A Danish toy company that sparked controversy by refusing to sell bricks to Ai Weiwei for a political artwork, later reversing its sales policy.

description.zh-cn: 维基解密创始人，艾未未曾公开抗议将其引渡至美国的司法程序。
description.en: Founder of WikiLeaks. Ai Weiwei publicly protested the legal proceedings to extradite him to the United States.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未是诗人艾青的儿子。
description.en: Ai Weiwei is the son of the poet Ai Qing.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未是高瑛的儿子。
description.en: Ai Weiwei is the son of Gao Ying.

description.zh-cn: 路青是艾未未的配偶。
description.en: Lu Qing is the spouse of Ai Weiwei.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未于1957年5月18日出生于北京。
description.en: Ai Weiwei was born in Beijing on May 18, 1957.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未于1978年入读北京电影学院动画系。
description.en: Ai Weiwei enrolled in the Animation Department of the Beijing Film Academy in 1978.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未于1981年前往美国，后入读纽约帕森设计学院。
description.en: Ai Weiwei went to the United States in 1981 and later enrolled at Parsons School of Design in New York.

description.zh-cn: 中国当局于2011年4月3日将艾未未秘密关押81天，释放后发起“发课税案”对其进行打压，并扣押其护照直至2015年7月。
description.en: Chinese authorities secretly detained Ai Weiwei for 81 days starting April 3, 2011. After his release, they launched the 'Fake Tax Case' to suppress him and confiscated his passport until July 2015.

description.zh-cn: 2009年8月，成都公安人员在酒店殴打艾未未致其脑出血。2011年4月，北京公安主导了对艾未未的秘密关押和后续的税务案件调查。
description.en: In August 2009, Chengdu police officers assaulted Ai Weiwei in a hotel, causing a cerebral hemorrhage. In April 2011, Beijing police led his secret detention and the subsequent tax case investigation.

description.zh-cn: 据报道，时任北京市公安局局长傅政华主导了对艾未未的审讯和迫害。
description.en: According to reports, Fu Zhenghua, then director of the Beijing Municipal Public Security Bureau, led the interrogation and persecution of Ai Weiwei.

relationships.target: 汶川大地震死难学生调查活动

description.zh-cn: 艾未未在网络上发起5.12地震公民调查活动，召集志愿者调查遇难学生名单。
description.en: Ai Weiwei initiated the May 12 Earthquake Citizens' Investigation online, calling for volunteers to investigate the list of student victims.

relationships.target: 汶川大地震死难学生调查活动

description.zh-cn: 汶川大地震中大量校舍坍塌导致学生遇难，促使艾未未发起了公民调查。
description.en: The collapse of numerous school buildings during the Wenchuan earthquake, which resulted in student casualties, prompted Ai Weiwei to launch the citizens' investigation.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未应律师邀请，作为证人前往成都为四川维权人士谭作人出庭作证。
description.en: At the invitation of a lawyer, Ai Weiwei traveled to Chengdu to appear in court as a witness for Sichuan rights activist Tan Zuoren.

description.zh-cn: 在杨佳被处决后，艾未未撰写博客并制作纪录片《一个孤僻的人》，质疑杨佳袭警案的司法公正性。
description.en: After Yang Jia was executed, Ai Weiwei wrote blog posts and produced the documentary 'One Recluse' to question the judicial fairness of Yang Jia's case of attacking police.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未探视并采访了被迫滞留日本成田机场的维权人士冯正虎，并制作纪录片《美好生活》声援其回家。
description.en: Ai Weiwei visited and interviewed activist Feng Zhenghu, who was forced to stay at Japan's Narita Airport, and produced the documentary 'A Beautiful Life' to support his return home.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未与瑞士赫尔佐格和德梅隆建筑事务所合作，担任北京国家体育场“鸟巢”项目的艺术顾问。
description.en: Ai Weiwei collaborated with the Swiss architectural firm Herzog & de Meuron, serving as the artistic consultant for the Beijing National Stadium 'Bird's Nest' project.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未作为艺术顾问，参与了国家体育场“鸟巢”的设计工作。
description.en: As an artistic consultant, Ai Weiwei participated in the design work for the National Stadium, the 'Bird's Nest'.

description.zh-cn: 根据案卷材料，发课税案是由北京市公安局于2011年4月6日交办给北京地税局的任务。
description.en: According to case file materials, the Fake Tax Case was a task assigned by the Beijing Municipal Public Security Bureau to the Beijing Local Taxation Bureau on April 6, 2011.

description.zh-cn: 北京市地税局以发课税案为由，向艾未未的公司开出1522万元的补罚税款决定，此案被广泛视为对艾未未的政治打压。
description.en: The Beijing Local Taxation Bureau, citing the Fake Tax Case, issued a decision ordering Ai Weiwei's company to pay 15.22 million yuan in back taxes and fines, a move widely seen as political persecution against him.

description.zh-cn: 浦志强作为发课公司的代理律师，在“发课税案”中为艾未未方提供法律辩护。
description.en: As the legal counsel for Fake Ltd., Pu Zhiqiang provided legal defense for Ai Weiwei's side in the 'Fake Tax Case'.

description.zh-cn: 自艾未未被捕后，《环球时报》发表多篇社评，如《法律不会为特立独行者弯曲》，对其进行批评。
description.en: After Ai Weiwei's arrest, the Global Times published multiple editorials criticizing him, such as 'The Law Will Not Bend for Mavericks'.

description.zh-cn: 香港《文汇报》连续发文，称艾未未“五毒俱全”，涉嫌多宗罪名。
description.en: The Hong Kong newspaper Wen Wei Po published a series of articles accusing Ai Weiwei of being 'thoroughly corrupt' and involved in multiple crimes.

description.zh-cn: 立法会议员容海恩公开指责艾未未的作品《透视研究：天安门》涉嫌违反国安法和“侮辱国家尊严”，导致该作品面临审查。
description.en: Legislative Council member Yung Hoi-yan publicly accused Ai Weiwei's work 'Study of Perspective: Tiananmen' of violating the National Security Law and 'insulting national dignity,' leading to censorship of the artwork.

description.zh-cn: 在政治压力下，M+博物馆最终决定不在开馆时展出其收藏的艾未未作品《透视研究：天安门》。
description.en: Under political pressure, the M+ museum ultimately decided not to exhibit its collected work by Ai Weiwei, 'Study of Perspective: Tiananmen,' at its opening.

description.zh-cn: 2015年9月，乐高公司以作品含政治动机为由，拒绝向艾未未出售积木。该决定在引发公众抗议后于2016年1月被撤销。
description.en: In September 2015, The Lego Group refused to sell bricks to Ai Weiwei, citing political motives in his work. The decision was reversed in January 2016 following public outcry.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未在伦敦法院外进行无声抗议，反对将维基解密创始人朱利安·阿桑奇引渡到美国。
description.en: Ai Weiwei held a silent protest outside a London court to oppose the extradition of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to the United States.
